intro: Urginea senegalensis, commonly known as the African arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures. Its adaptability to various soil types makes it a resilient species in arid environments.
